channel.title: [PI] Cleaning up a command

item.title: [PI] Cleaning up a command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So, I have a command in my server called settitle. It basically changes your title to what ever the number is in the client sided switch. It’s a very horribly made command (I didn’t make it :P) and I want to fix it. Considering all the titles aren’t even correct as is.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("settitle") && c.isDonator == 1) {
		String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
			if (args.length == 2) {
				int titleId = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
				c.playerTitle = titleId;
				c.getPA().requestUpdates();
			}
			if (c.playerTitle == 1) {
				c.sendMessage("You have set your title to: <shad=16743680>Lord</col>.");
				return;
			} else if (c.playerTitle == 2) {
				c.sendMessage("You have set your title to: <shad=16743680>Sir</col>.");
				return;
			} else if (c.playerTitle == 3) {
				c.sendMessage("You have set your title to: <shad=16743680>Lionheart</col>.");

				return;
			} else {
				c.sendMessage("You do not have this title unlocked. Your title has been reset.");
				c.playerTitle = 0;
				return;
			
			}
}

That’s the command, all the titles in it were from the previous owner.
